FRAMESHIFT_ELONGATION.name: Frameshift elongation
FRAMESHIFT_ELONGATION.desc: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be extended relative to the reference feature (is a {@link #FRAMESHIFT_VARIANT}, internal_feature_elongation).

FRAMESHIFT_TRUNCATION.name: Frameshift truncation
FRAMESHIFT_TRUNCATION.desc: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be shortened relative to the reference feature (is a {@link #FRAMESHIFT_VARIANT}, internal_feature_truncation).

FRAMESHIFT_VARIANT.name: Frameshift variant
FRAMESHIFT_VARIANT.desc:
A sequence variant which causes a disruption of the translational reading frame, because the number of nucleotides inserted or deleted is not a multiple of three (is a: protein_altering_variant).
Used for frameshift variant for the case where there is no stop codon any more and the rare case in which the transcript length is retained.

INTERNAL_FEATURE_ELONGATION.name: Internal feature elongation
INTERNAL_FEATURE_ELONGATION.desc:
A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature from within the feature rather than from the terminus of the feature, with regard to the reference sequence.
In Jannovar, used to annotate a {@link #COMPLEX_SUBSTITUTION} that does not lead to a frameshift and increases the transcript length.

FEATURE_TRUNCATION.name: Feature truncation
FEATURE_TRUNCATION.desc:
A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence (is a: feature_variant).
The term INTERNAL_FEATURE_TRUNCATION would be more fitting but is not available in SO.
In Jannovar, used to annotate a {@link #COMPLEX_SUBSTITUTION} that does not lead to a frameshift and decreases the transcript length and structural variants.

TRANSCRIPT_AMPLIFICATION.name: Transcript amplification
TRANSCRIPT_AMPLIFICATION.desc:
A feature amplification of a region containing a transcript.
In Jannovar, used together with {@link #STRUCTURAL_VARIANT} to denote an SV copy number gain.

COPY_NUMBER_CHANGE.name: Copy number change
COPY_NUMBER_CHANGE.desc:
A sequence variant where copies of a feature (CNV) are either increased or decreased.
In Jannovar, used together with {@link #STRUCTURAL_VARIANT} to denote an SV copy number gain.

MNV.name: MNV
MNV.desc:
A MNV is a multiple nucleotide variant (substitution) in which the inserted sequence is the same length as the replaced sequence (is a: substitution).
In Jannovar, only used for marking MNVs in coding regions.

COMPLEX_SUBSTITUTION.name: Complex substitution
COMPLEX_SUBSTITUTION.desc:
When no simple or well defined DNA mutation event describes the observed DNA change, the keyword "complex" should be used. Usually there are multiple equally plausible explanations for the change (is a: substitution).
Used together with {@link #INTERNAL_FEATURE_ELONGATION} or {@link #FEATURE_TRUNCATION} to describe an variant that does not lead to a frameshift but a changed transcript length. Used together with {@link #FRAMESHIFT_ELONGATION} or {@link #FRAMESHIFT_TRUNCATION} if the substitution leads to a frameshift variant.

STOP_GAINED.name: Stop gained
STOP_GAINED.desc: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon is changed, resulting in a premature stop codon, leading to a shortened transcript (is a: nonsynonymous_variant, feature_truncation).

STOP_LOST.name: Stop lost
STOP_LOST.desc: A sequence variant where at least one base of the terminator codon (stop) is changed, resulting in an elongated transcript (is a: nonsynonymous variant, terminator_codon_variant, feature_elongation).

START_LOST.name: Start lost
START_LOST.desc: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the canonical start codon (is a: initiator_codon_variant).

SPLICE_ACCEPTOR_VARIANT.name: Splice acceptor variant
SPLICE_ACCEPTOR_VARIANT.desc: A splice variant that changes the 2 base region at the 3' end of an intron (is a {@link #SPLICE_REGION_VARIANT}).

SPLICE_DONOR_VARIANT.name: Splice donor variant
SPLICE_DONOR_VARIANT.desc: A splice variant that changes the 2 base pair region at the 5' end of an intron (is a {@link #SPLICE_REGION_VARIANT}).

RARE_AMINO_ACID_VARIANT.name: Rare amino acid variant
RARE_AMINO_ACID_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding a rare amino acid is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid (children: selenocysteine_loss, pyrrolysine_loss).

MISSENSE_VARIANT.name: Missense variant
MISSENSE_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant, that changes one or more bases, resulting in a different amino acid sequence but where the length is preserved.

INFRAME_INSERTION.name: Inframe insertion
INFRAME_INSERTION.desc: An inframe non synonymous variant that inserts bases into in the coding sequence (is a: inframe_indel, internal_feature_elongation).

DISRUPTIVE_INFRAME_INSERTION.name: Disruptive inframe insertion
DISRUPTIVE_INFRAME_INSERTION.desc: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence within an existing codon (is a: {@link #INFRAME_INSERTION}).

INFRAME_DELETION.name: Inframe deletion
INFRAME_DELETION.desc: An inframe non synonymous variant that deletes bases from the coding sequence (is a: inframe_indel, feature_truncation).

DISRUPTIVE_INFRAME_DELETION.name: Disruptive inframe deletion
DISRUPTIVE_INFRAME_DELETION.desc: An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes bases from the coding sequence starting within an existing codon (is a: {@link #INFRAME_DELETION}).

THREE_PRIME_UTR_TRUNCATION.name: 3' UTR truncation
THREE_PRIME_UTR_TRUNCATION.desc: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 3'UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

FIVE_PRIME_UTR_TRUNCATION.name: 5' UTR truncation
FIVE_PRIME_UTR_TRUNCATION.desc: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 5'UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

SPLICE_REGION_VARIANT.name: Splice region variant
SPLICE_REGION_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant in which a change has occurred within the region of the splice site, either within 1-3 bases of the exon or 3-8 bases of the intron (is a: {@link #SPLICING_VARIANT}).

STOP_RETAINED_VARIANT.name: Stop retained variant
STOP_RETAINED_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant where at least one base in the terminator codon is changed, but the terminator remains (is a: {@link #SYNONYMOUS_VARIANT}, terminator_codon_variant).

INITIATOR_CODON_VARIANT.name: Initiator codon variant
INITIATOR_CODON_VARIANT.desc: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the first codon of a transcript (is a: {@link #CODING_SEQUENCE_VARIANT}, children: start_retained_variant, start_lost).

SYNONYMOUS_VARIANT.name: Synonymous variant
SYNONYMOUS_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant where there is no resulting change to the encoded amino acid (is a: {@link #CODING_SEQUENCE_VARIANT}, children: start_retained_variant, stop_retained_variant).

CODING_TRANSCRIPT_INTRON_VARIANT.name: Coding transcript intron variant
CODING_TRANSCRIPT_INTRON_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes non-coding intro sequence in a non-coding transcript (is a: {@link #CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}, {@link #INTRON_VARIANT}).

FIVE_PRIME_UTR_PREMATURE_START_CODON_GAI.name: 5' UTR premature start codon gain variant
FIVE_PRIME_UTR_PREMATURE_START_CODON_GAI.desc: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is introduced, moved or lost (is a: {@link #FIVE_PRIME_UTR_EXON_VARIANT} or {@link #FIVE_PRIME_UTR_INTRON_VARIANT}).

FIVE_PRIME_UTR_EXON_VARIANT.name: 5' UTR exon variant
FIVE_PRIME_UTR_EXON_VARIANT.desc: A UTR variant of the 5' UTR (is a: 5_prime_UTR_variant; is a: UTR_variant).

THREE_PRIME_UTR_EXON_VARIANT.name: 3' UTR exon variant
THREE_PRIME_UTR_EXON_VARIANT.desc: A UTR variant of the 3' UTR (is a: 3_prime_UTR_variant; is a: UTR_variant).

FIVE_PRIME_UTR_INTRON_VARIANT.name: 5' UTR intron variant
FIVE_PRIME_UTR_INTRON_VARIANT.desc: A UTR variant between 5' UTRs (is a: 5_prime_UTR_variant; is a: UTR_variant).

THREE_PRIME_UTR_INTRON_VARIANT.name: 3' UTR intron variant
THREE_PRIME_UTR_INTRON_VARIANT.desc: A UTR variant between 3' UTRs (is a: 3_prime_UTR_variant; is a: UTR_variant).

NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_EXON_VARIANT.name: Non coding transcript exon variant
NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_EXON_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes non-coding exon sequence in a non-coding transcript (is a: {@link #NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}, {@link #EXON_VARIANT}).

NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_INTRON_VARIANT.name: Non coding transcript intron variant
NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_INTRON_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes non-coding intro sequence in a non-coding transcript (is a: {@link #NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}, {@link #INTRON_VARIANT}).

DIRECT_TANDEM_DUPLICATION.name: Direct tandem duplication
DIRECT_TANDEM_DUPLICATION.desc:
A tandem duplication where the individual regions are in the same orientation (is a: tandem_duplication).
In Jannovar used, as an additional marker to describe that a duplication is a tandem duplication.

MOBILE_ELEMENT_DELETION.name: Mobile element deletion
MOBILE_ELEMENT_DELETION.desc:
A deletion of a mobile element when comparing a reference sequence (has mobile element) to a individual sequence (does not have mobile element).
In Jannovar used, as an additional marker to describe that a deletion is a mobile element deletion.

MOBILE_ELEMENT_INSERTION.name: Mobile element insertion
MOBILE_ELEMENT_INSERTION.desc:
A kind of insertion where the inserted sequence is a mobile element.
In Jannovar used, as an additional marker to describe that an insertion is a mobile element insertion.

UPSTREAM_GENE_VARIANT.name: Upstream gene variant
UPSTREAM_GENE_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant located 5' of a gene (is a: {@link #INTERGENIC_VARIANT}).

DOWNSTREAM_GENE_VARIANT.name: Downstream gene variant
DOWNSTREAM_GENE_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant located 3' of a gene (is a: {@link #INTERGENIC_VARIANT}).

INTERGENIC_VARIANT.name: Intergenic variant
INTERGENIC_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant located in the intergenic region, between genes (is a: feature_variant).

TFBS_ABLATION.name: TFBS ablation
TFBS_ABLATION.desc: An ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcription factor binding site.

TFBS_AMPLIFICATION.name: TFBS amplification
TFBS_AMPLIFICATION.desc: An amplification of a region containing a transcription factor binding site.

TF_BINDING_SITE_VARIANT.name: TF binding site variant
TF_BINDING_SITE_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant located within a transcription factor binding site (is a: {@link #REGULATORY_REGION_VARIANT}).

REGULATORY_REGION_VARIANT.name: Regulatory region variant
REGULATORY_REGION_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant located within a regulatory region (is a: feature_variant).

REGULATORY_REGION_ABLATION.name: Regulatory region ablation
REGULATORY_REGION_ABLATION.desc: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a regulatory region.

REGULATORY_REGION_AMPLIFICATION.name: Regulatory region amplification
REGULATORY_REGION_AMPLIFICATION.desc: Amplification of a region containing a regulatory region.

CONSERVED_INTRON_VARIANT.name: Conserved intron variant
CONSERVED_INTRON_VARIANT.desc: A transcript variant occurring within a conserved region of an intron (is a: {@link #INTRON_VARIANT}).

INTRAGENIC_VARIANT.name: Intragenic variant
INTRAGENIC_VARIANT.desc: A variant that occurs within a gene but falls outside of all transcript features. This occurs when alternate transcripts of a gene do not share overlapping sequence (is a: {@link #TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}).

CONSERVED_INTERGENIC_VARIANT.name: Conserved intergenic variant
CONSERVED_INTERGENIC_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant located in a conserved intergenic region, between genes (is a: {@link #INTERGENIC_VARIANT}).

STRUCTURAL_VARIANT.name: Structural variant
STRUCTURAL_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes one or more sequence features (is a: sequence variant).

CODING_SEQUENCE_VARIANT.name: Coding sequence variant
CODING_SEQUENCE_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes the coding sequence (is a: {@link #CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}, {@link #EXON_VARIANT}). Sequence Ontology does not have a term for CODING_TRANSCRIPT_EXON_VARIANT, so we use this.

INTRON_VARIANT.name: Intron variant
INTRON_VARIANT.desc:
A transcript variant occurring within an intron (is a: {@link #TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}).
Jannovar uses {@link #CODING_TRANSCRIPT_INTRON_VARIANT} and {@link #NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_INTRON_VARIANT} instead.

EXON_VARIANT.name: Exon variant
EXON_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes exon sequence (is a: {@link #TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}).

SPLICING_VARIANT.name: Splicing variant
SPLICING_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes the process of splicing (is a: {@link #GENE_VARIANT}).

MIRNA.name: miRNA
MIRNA.desc: Variant affects a miRNA (is a: miRNA_primary_transcript, small_regulatory_ncRNA).

GENE_VARIANT.name: Gene variant
GENE_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant where the structure of the gene is changed (is a: feature_variant).

CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT.name: Coding transcript variant
CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT.desc:
A transcript variant of a protein coding transcript (is a: {@link #TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT}).
Used, e.g., for marking SVs as affecting coding transcripts.

NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT.name: Non coding transcript variant
NON_CODING_TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT.desc: Used, e.g., for marking splicing variants as non-coding or SVs as affecting non-coding transcripts.

TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT.name: Transcript variant
TRANSCRIPT_VARIANT.desc: A sequence variant that changes the structure of the transcript.

INTERGENIC_REGION.name: Intergenic region
INTERGENIC_REGION.desc: A region containing or overlapping no genes that is bounded on either side by a gene, or bounded by a gene and the end of the chromosome (is a: biological_region).

CHROMOSOME.name: Chromosome
CHROMOSOME.desc: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication (is a: replicon).

SEQUENCE_VARIANT.name: Sequence variant
SEQUENCE_VARIANT.desc: Top level term for variants, can be used for marking "uknown effect".

AUTOSOMAL_DOMINANT.name: Autosomal dominant
AUTOSOMAL_DOMINANT.desc: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in heterozygotes. In the context of medical genetics, an autosomal dominant disorder is caused when a single copy of the mutant allele is present. Males and females are affected equally, and can both transmit the disorder with a risk of 50% for each child of inheriting the mutant allele.

AUTOSOMAL_RECESSIVE.name: Autosomal recessive
AUTOSOMAL_RECESSIVE.desc: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on one of the autosomes (i.e., the human chromosomes 1-22) in which a trait manifests in individuals with two pathogenic alleles, either homozygotes (two copies of the same mutant allele) or compound heterozygotes (whereby each copy of a gene has a distinct mutant allele).

X_RECESSIVE.name: X-linked recessive
X_RECESSIVE.desc: A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.

X_DOMINANT.name: X-linked dominant inheritance
X_DOMINANT.desc: A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.

MITOCHONDRIAL.name: Mitochondrial inheritance
MITOCHONDRIAL.desc: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome. Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).

ANY.name: Any inheritance mode
ANY.desc: Inheritance mode could not be determined.

benign.name: Benign
benign.desc: As recommended by ACMG/AMP for variants interpreted for Mendelian disorders.

likely_benign.name: Likely benign
likely_benign.desc: As recommended by ACMG/AMP for variants interpreted for Mendelian disorders.

uncertain.name: Uncertain significance
uncertain.desc: As recommended by ACMG/AMP for variants interpreted for Mendelian disorders.

likely_pathogenic.name: Likely pathogenic
likely_pathogenic.desc: As recommended by ACMG/AMP for variants interpreted for Mendelian disorders.

pathogenic.name: Pathogenic
pathogenic.desc: As recommended by ACMG/AMP for variants interpreted for Mendelian disorders. Variants that are pathogenic with low penetrance may be submitted as "Pathogenic"; please also include information about the penetrance in a "Comment on clinical significance".

drug_response.name: drug response
drug_response.desc: A general term for a variant that affects a drug response, not a disease. We anticipate adding more specific drug response terms based on a recommendation by CPIC.

association.name: association
association.desc: For variants identified in a GWAS study and further interpreted for their clinical significance.

risk factor.name: risk factor
risk factor.desc: For variants that are interpreted not to cause a disorder but to increase the risk.

protective.name: protective
protective.desc: For variants that decrease the risk of a disorder, including infections.

Affects.name: Affects
Affects.desc: For variants that cause a non-disease phenotype, such as lactose intolerance.

conflicting data from submitters.name: conflicting data from submitters
conflicting data from submitters.desc: Only for submissions from a consortium, where groups within the consortium have conflicting intepretations of a variant but provide a single submission to ClinVar.

other.name: other
other.desc: If ClinVar does not have the appropriate term for your submission, we ask that you submit "other" as clinical significance and contact us to discuss if there are other terms we should add.

not_provided.name: not provided
not_provided.desc: For submissions without an interpretation of clinical significance.

whitelist_variant.name: Known pathogenic variant
whitelist_variant.desc: A variant that is known to be pathogenic in ClinVar.
